articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines accused Chinese Coast Guard ships on Friday of carrying out aggressive manoeuvres and targeting its fisheries vessels with water canons while they were delivering supplies to Filipino fishermen at the disputed Scarborough Shoal on Friday.
articles.title: Philippines accuses China coast guard of aggressive manoeuvres against its fisheries vessels

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: Israel's ambassador to the United Nations in Geneva has raised "vehement objection" to Iran addressing the Human Rights Council ahead of talks with European counterparts in Geneva to try to de-escalate the conflict, according to a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Israel slams UN rights council for giving floor to Iran ahead of nuclear talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Switzerland will spend 269 million Swiss francs ($329.37 million) to support Geneva as a hub for international diplomacy, the government said on Friday, amid growing financial pressure on global institutions hit by spending cuts and lower donations.
articles.title: Swiss to spend $329 million to support Geneva as diplomatic hub

articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Israel and Iran's air war entered a second week on Friday and European officials sought to draw Tehran back to the negotiating table after President Donald Trump said any decision on potential U.S. involvement would be made within two weeks.
articles.title: Israel-Iran air war enters second week as Europe pushes diplomacy

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court let Donald Trump on Thursday retain control over California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the legality of the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests and unrest in Los Angeles.
articles.title: US court lets Trump retain control of California National Guard for now

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One person was killed and at least 14 were injured when Russian drones attacked the Ukrainian Black Sea city of Odesa overnight, damaging high-rise buildings and railway infrastructure, local authorities and prosecutors said on Friday.
articles.title: One killed, 14 injured in overnight Russian attack on Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian activist who helped collect humanitarian aid for Ukraine and evacuate Ukrainians from the war zone was sentenced on Friday to 22 years in prison by a Moscow military court, the RIA state news agency reported.
articles.title: Russia sentences activist who helped Ukrainians flee war to 22 years in prison

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan will hold a recall vote for around one quarter of parliament's lawmakers - all from the main opposition party - next month, the election commission said on Friday, a move which could see the ruling party take back control of the legislature.
articles.title: Taiwan to hold recall election for lawmakers that could reshape parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pro-Palestinian activists in Britain said they had broken into a Royal Air Force base in central England on Friday and damaged two military aircraft.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian activists say they damaged planes at UK military base

articles.author: Panarat Thepgumpanat, Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Thailand's embattled Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra was facing the prospect of losing her government's majority on Friday as a vital coalition partner looked set to demand her resignation after just 10 months in power.
articles.title: Thai PM faces call to step down to avert coalition revolt
